primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in a world occupied by the reigning monarchs of Sin and Death to liberate humanity through the 'second man', Jesus Christ.

subject.identificatie: God (specifically through the person of Jesus Christ)
tekstueel_bewijs: God has done to deliver us from a future of our own making
He [Christ] was driving the demons out
He is the new man who is able to create a new humanity
the free gift following many trespasses brings justification
acquittal and life for all men
promise of a completely remade future

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The 'Old Story' of Scripture
tekstueel_bewijs: One generation shall praise thy works to another

ontvanger.identificatie: Humanity ('The many', 'The elders and the children')
tekstueel_bewijs: acquittal and life for all men
I am among you as a fellow prisoner who brings news of impending release
The only way of victory is through the Cross
This is our responsibility... to tell them this old story

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin and Death (as personified cosmic tyrants)
tekstueel_bewijs: Sin as a reigning monarch, in league with its fellow tyrant Death
God has a very real personal Enemy who is bent on victory
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is not described as a mistake but as an 'annihilating army' and 'iron rule' that removes human choice.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The elders passing the 'Old Story' to the next generation as a counter-narrative to modern technological/cultural optimism.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Elders/The Church
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (witness) is the response to the primary program (God's act in Christ).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has done to deliver us
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We have left undone those things

voorbeelden: This is our responsibility and our calling
We too wanted to be part of writing a new story
The elders used to be able to say... I know
no one has been able to choose to step outside the iron rule
The human being does not have the capacity
He is the new man who is able

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the total loss of human 'Pouvoir' (power) due to Sin, and the restoration of 'Pouvoir' through Christ's victory.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Starts at ~S2 (Mead's false freedom), moves to S2 (The reality of Sin/Death), and resolves in S1 (Grace abounding).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Much More' of Christ, which overpowers the 'One Man' of Adam.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; Sin is treated as a cosmic occupation.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It explicitly rejects human capacity to solve the human predicament and places all agency for salvation on Christ.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: We can only do it by doing it his way.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God has done to deliver us from a future of our own making.
Sin as a reigning monarch... an annihilating army.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Christ is not an example to follow but a Victor who creates a new reality.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Adam (as a negative type of our condition, not an example)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: Christ does what we cannot.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and surrender; moving from the burden of 'creating a future' to receiving a gift.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon perfectly integrates the human cultural failure with the biblical narrative of the Fall and Redemption.
spanning_punten: The tension between human 'responsibility' to tell the story and the 'total inability' of humans to save themselves.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Christ's victory over the demonic Powers... driving the demons out.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on Christological endowment rather than Pneumatological indwelling.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Absolute; Sin is an 'iron rule' that negates human choice.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject. It avoids the 'Moralistic Gap' by refusing to give the hearer a 'to-do' list to achieve salvation.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Strongly weighted toward Pouvoir (Inability vs. God's Ability).
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is appropriate for a Lent/Romans 5 sermon.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Could slightly increase the 'Vouloir' (desire) for the new life.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A profound example of Rutledge's own 'Grammar of Grace'. The sermon dismantles human optimism to make room for divine hope.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the Margaret Mead anecdote; semiotics shows the anecdote serves to establish the 'Opponent' (Sin/Death) as insurmountable by human progress.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Romans 5; semiotics shows how the sermon functions as a 'delivery system' for the same actantial roles Paul uses.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Elders' are not the Subject of the primary narrative, but merely Helpers/Messengers, preventing the sermon from becoming a lecture on parenting.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Much More' logic of Paul to shift the actantial power from the Opponent to the Subject.
